intro: Raphionacme linearis var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth linear raphionacme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, grass-like leaves that are typically linear and smooth to the touch, as indicated by its varietal name "glabra." The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying wetland ecosystems.
